intro: Draba arauquensis, commonly known as the Andean rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, forming a rosette, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Draba arauquensis is adapted to cold climates and is often found at high elevations.
